intro: Oblixilis, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, silver-gray leaves that reflect light and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Oblixilis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is also known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
